<div class="css-1vkm6nb ehdk2mb0">

# Fact-Checking Trump’s Speech and More: Night 4 of the Republican National Convention

</div>

<div class="live-blog-header-timestamp css-1c95nef">

<span>Last Updated <span class="css-1xu7vd"></span></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 28, 2020, 11:54 a.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 28, 2020, 11:54
a.m. ET</span>

</div>

![<span class="css-16f3y1r e13ogyst0" data-aria-hidden="true">President
Trump making an early appearance on the South Lawn of the White House,
where he later accepted the Republican nomination for a second
term.</span><span class="css-cnj6d5 e1z0qqy90" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1ly73wi e1tej78p0">Credit...</span><span>Doug
Mills/The New York
Times</span></span>](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/08/27/us/27dc-factcheck-sub2/27dc-factcheck-sub2-articleLarge.jpg?quality=75&auto=webp&disable=upscale)

  - In accepting his party’s nomination for a second term on the fourth
    and final night of the Republican National Convention, President
    Trump mixed a robust defense of his own record with a scathing
    attack on his Democratic opponent, Joseph R. Biden Jr. During his
    70-minute speech from the South Lawn of the White House, he often
    exaggerated his own accomplishments and skated over his failures
    while portraying Democrats and Mr. Biden inaccurately.

  - On the pandemic, the president exaggerated the strength of his
    administration’s response, from [the partial travel
    ban](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#when-i-took-bold-action-to-issue-a-travel-ban-on-china-very-early-indeed-joe-biden-called-it-hysterical-and-xenophobic)
    he imposed on China to the [supply of personal protective
    equipment](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#we-shipped-hundreds-of-millions-of-masks-gloves-and-gowns-to-our-front-line-health-care-workers),
    and he promised a vaccine by the end of the year — [if not
    sooner](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#we-are-delivering-lifesaving-therapies-and-will-produce-a-vaccine-before-the-end-of-the-year-or-maybe-even-sooner)
    — despite serious doubts about that timetable among scientists. He
    also incorrectly characterized a number of [Mr. Biden’s
    positions](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#instead-of-following-the-science-joe-biden-wants-to-inflict-a-painful-shutdown-on-the-entire-country)
    on the crisis.

  - Mr. Trump twisted positions held by Mr. Biden and Democrats on
    [defunding the
    police](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#make-no-mistake-if-you-give-power-to-joe-biden-the-radical-left-will-defund-police-departments-all-across-america),
    [energy
    policy](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#biden-has-promised-to-abolish-the-production-of-american-oil-coal-shale-and-natural-gas-these-same-policies-led-to-crippling-pow)
    and [abortion
    rights](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#joe-biden-claims-he-has-empathy-for-the-vulnerable-yet-the-party-he-leads-supports-the-extreme-late-term-abortion-of-defenseless),
    among other issues. And the president claimed to have lived up to
    his promises on other subjects, like building a border wall, even
    where the evidence [does not back him
    up](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/live/2020/08/27/us/rnc-fact-check#we-have-already-built-300-miles-of-border-wall-and-we-are-adding-10-new-miles-every-single-week-the-wall-will-soon-be-complete-a).

  - A team of New York Times reporters followed the developments and
    fact-checked the speakers, providing context and explanation. And we
    also fact [checked the Democratic National
    Convention.](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/08/21/us/politics/fact-check-democrats.html)

</div>

<div id="feed-top" class="css-7pw99z">

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312581">

<div id="the-united-states-has-among-the-lowest-case-fatality-rates-of-any-major-country-in-the-world" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/06/12/multimedia/author-linda-qiu/author-linda-qiu-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/linda-qiu)[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/08/11/reader-center/author-katherine-j-wu/author-katherine-j-wu-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/katherine-j--wu)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 28, 2020, 12:08 a.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 28, 2020, 12:08
a.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Linda
Qiu</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/linda-qiu) and
[<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Katherine J.
Wu</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/katherine-j--wu)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“The United States has among the lowest case fatality rates of any major country in the world.”](#the-united-states-has-among-the-lowest-case-fatality-rates-of-any-major-country-in-the-world)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**False.** </span>

This figure, which calculates the number of people known to have the
coronavirus who ultimately die from the disease, is currently just above
3 percent in the United States, putting it in roughly the top third of
countries afflicted by the coronavirus.

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

The United States has the 51st highest observed case fatality rate out
of 170 countries, [according to Johns Hopkins
University](https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/data/mortality), and has the
22nd highest of the 37 countries of the Organization for Economic
Cooperation and Development.

The United States also has a relatively high death rate when calculated
as deaths per capita, registering [more than 50 deaths per 100,000
people over the course of the
pandemic](https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/data/mortality). That puts the
country squarely in the top 10 countries with the most deaths per
capita, when excluding countries like Andorra and San Marino, which have
had relatively few coronavirus cases. And the U.S. still leads the world
in absolute death counts, with more than 180,000 dead as of Thursday
evening, according to a [New York Times
database.](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/world/coronavirus-maps.html)

</div>

Read
more

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312593">

<div id="we-will-go-right-after-china-we-will-not-rely-on-them-one-bit-we-are-taking-our-business-out-of-china-we-are-bringing-it-home-we" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/12/10/multimedia/author-ana-swanson/author-ana-swanson-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/ana-swanson)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:44 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:44
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Ana
Swanson</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/ana-swanson)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“We will go right after China. We will not rely on them one bit. We are taking our business out of China; we are bringing it home. We want our business to come home.”](#we-will-go-right-after-china-we-will-not-rely-on-them-one-bit-we-are-taking-our-business-out-of-china-we-are-bringing-it-home-we)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is exaggerated. </span>

President Trump has pushed to “decouple” the American economy from
China’s, imposing hefty tariffs on Chinese products that have
encouraged companies to move their operations. Trade with China [fell
sharply last
year](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/02/05/business/economy/trump-trade.html),
and Chinese [investment in the United
States](https://rhg.com/research/two-way-street-us-china-investment-trends-2020-update/)
declined. But trade data suggests that most companies that have left
China have [relocated to other low-cost
countries](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/02/05/business/economy/trump-trade.html),
like Vietnam and Mexico.

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

Other companies have [decided to remain in
China](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/07/22/business/economy/coronavirus-globalization-jobs-supply-chain-china.html)
despite the tariffs, drawn by China’s enormous consumer market and
factory sector. American investment in China actually [edged up slightly
last
year](https://rhg.com/research/two-way-street-us-china-investment-trends-2020-update/).
Most economists and business leaders believe the world’s two largest
economies will remain significantly intertwined. And in some industries,
the Trump administration has actually worked to strengthen ties between
the countries.

Much of the limited trade deal that the president [signed with China in
January](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/01/15/business/economy/china-trade-deal.html)
was aimed at opening certain Chinese markets for American business,
especially finance and agriculture.

</div>

Read more

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312595">

<div id="we-will-greatly-expand-energy-development-continuing-to-remain-the-number-one-in-the-world-and-keep-america-energy-independent" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/10/03/multimedia/author-coral-davenport/author-coral-davenport-thumbLarge-v2.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/coral-davenport)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:43 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:43
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Coral
Davenport</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/coral-davenport)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“We will greatly expand energy development, continuing to remain the number one in the world, and keep America energy independent.”](#we-will-greatly-expand-energy-development-continuing-to-remain-the-number-one-in-the-world-and-keep-america-energy-independent)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is mostly true.</span>

According to the [Energy Information
Administration](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eia.gov%2Ftodayinenergy%2Fdetail.php%3Fid%3D40973),
the statistical arm of the Energy Department, the United States
surpassed Russia to become the world’s largest producer of natural gas
in 2011. The United States became the world’s largest producer of oil
and natural gas combined in 2014. And it surpassed Saudi Arabia in 2018
to become the world’s largest producer of petroleum.

However, the phrase “energy independence” suggests that the United
States is not reliant on imported energy sources. In fact, 2019, nearly
half the oil consumed by the United States — [about 9 million barrels
per
day](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eia.gov%2Ftools%2Ffaqs%2Ffaq.php%3Fid%3D727%26t%3D6%23%3A~%3Atext%3DIn%25202019%252C%2520the%2520United%2520States%2C\(including%2520ethanol%2520and%2520biodiesel\).)
— was imported, according to the Energy Information Administration, the
statistical arm of the Energy
Department.

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312592">

<div id="make-no-mistake-if-you-give-power-to-joe-biden-the-radical-left-will-defund-police-departments-all-across-america" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/05/19/reader-center/author-mike-baker/author-mike-baker-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/mike-baker)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:40 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:40
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Mike
Baker</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/mike-baker)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Make no mistake, if you give power to Joe Biden, the radical left will defund police departments all across America.”](#make-no-mistake-if-you-give-power-to-joe-biden-the-radical-left-will-defund-police-departments-all-across-america)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is misleading.** </span>

Some cities have been moving to cut police department budgets in recent
weeks. Mr. Trump implies here that Mr. Biden is a supporter of such
cuts, but [Mr. Biden has made clear that he opposes
defunding](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2020%2F06%2F08%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Fbiden-defund-the-police.html)
and instead has proposed “to get police more money.” Mr. Biden has also
expressed support for the Second Amendment, saying that he himself is a
gun owner. Mr. Biden does propose some firearm restrictions, [such as a
ban on assault
weapons](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2019%2F08%2F11%2Fopinion%2Fjoe-biden-ban-assault-weapons.html)
and high-capacity magazines. He also supports background checks and
other
regulations.

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312587">

<div id="biden-has-promised-to-abolish-the-production-of-american-oil-coal-shale-and-natural-gas-these-same-policies-led-to-crippling-pow" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/10/03/multimedia/author-coral-davenport/author-coral-davenport-thumbLarge-v2.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/coral-davenport)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:35 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:35
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Coral
Davenport</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/coral-davenport)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Biden has promised to abolish the production of American oil, coal, shale and natural gas. … These same policies led to crippling power outages in California just last week.”](#biden-has-promised-to-abolish-the-production-of-american-oil-coal-shale-and-natural-gas-these-same-policies-led-to-crippling-pow)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is false.</span>

As temperatures rose in California last week, the manager of much of the
state’s electric grid called on utilities to [cut power to hundreds of
thousands of
customers](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2020%2F08%2F16%2Fbusiness%2Fcalifornia-blackouts.html).
But the state’s energy experts also said that the utilities had plenty
of power available and that the blackouts weren’t necessary. California
has not banned production of oil and gas, and it is one of the nation’s
top 10 oil-producing states.

</div>

<div id="ad-1" class="css-4dvyd6">

<div class="css-142l3g4">

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312585">

<div id="remember-this-they-spied-on-my-campaign-and-they-got-caught" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/06/12/multimedia/author-charlie-savage/author-charlie-savage-thumbLarge-v2.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/charlie-savage)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:32 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:32
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Charlie
Savage</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/charlie-savage)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Remember this: They spied on my campaign and they got caught.”](#remember-this-they-spied-on-my-campaign-and-they-got-caught)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is misleading.** </span>

In July 2016, the F.B.I. opened a counterintelligence investigation into
Russia’s covert operation to tilt that year’s election in Mr. Trump’s
favor, including whether anyone associated with his campaign cooperated
with that effort, wittingly or unwittingly.

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

The F.B.I. used several confidential human informants to approach Trump
campaign associates to see what they would say about any advance
knowledge of Russia’s hacking and release of Democratic emails. It also
wiretapped Carter Page, a former Trump campaign adviser with ties to
Russian intelligence officials; Mr. Page had left the campaign by the
time a court approve the warrant, but wiretap orders permit the F.B.I.
to look at any older emails in a target’s account.

The purpose of this investigation was to understand the scope and nature
of an effort by a foreign adversary to manipulate an American election.
Calling it spying on his campaign connotes trying to gain an electoral
advantage, but there is no evidence that any information gathered by the
inquiry was provided to the Clinton campaign or leaked to affect the
vote.

</div>

Read
more

</div>

<div id="we-will-always-and-very-strongly-protect-patients-with-pre-existing-conditions-and-that-is-a-pledge-from-the-entire-republican-p" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2019/12/13/reader-center/author-margot-sanger-katz/author-margot-sanger-katz-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/margot-sanger-katz)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:31 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:31
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Margot
Sanger-Katz</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/margot-sanger-katz)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“We will always, and very strongly, protect patients with pre-existing conditions, and that is a pledge from the entire Republican Party.”](#we-will-always-and-very-strongly-protect-patients-with-pre-existing-conditions-and-that-is-a-pledge-from-the-entire-republican-p)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is misleading.</span>

The Affordable Care Act, signed by Barack Obama in 2010, established
protections for Americans with pre-existing health conditions, requiring
insurers to sell them the same plans offered to people without prior
health problems. Though President Trump often says he supports the idea,
he has [taken numerous
actions](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2020%2F01%2F13%2Fupshot%2Ftrump-tweets-health-care.html)
that would weaken those protections. He supported legislation early in
his term that would have overturned the Affordable Care Act and
[undermined the comprehensiveness of health
benefits](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2017%2F04%2F04%2Fupshot%2Ffreedom-caucus-health-care-pre-existing-conditions.html).
He has [expanded the
availability](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2018%2F08%2F01%2Fus%2Fpolitics%2Ftrump-short-term-health-insurance.html)
of skimpy insurance that [does not need to offer
plans](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2018%2F08%2F01%2Fupshot%2Fbuying-short-term-health-insurance-what-to-know.html)
to people with pre-existing conditions. And his Justice Department is
involved in a lawsuit, [currently before the Supreme
Court](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion%2F2020%2F03%2F02%2Fus%2Fsupreme-court-obamacare-appeal.html),
that would overturn the health law in its entirety. The president has
provided no details about what policy would replace the health law — and
help patients with pre-existing conditions — if he were to prevail in
that
suit.

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312578">

<div id="during-the-democrat-convention-the-words-under-god-were-removed-from-the-pledge-of-allegiance-not-once-but-twice-we-will-never-d" class="css-608m5d">

[<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Sheryl Gay

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“During the Democrat Convention, the words ‘under God’ were removed from the Pledge of Allegiance — not once, but twice. We will never do that. But the fact is, this is where they are coming from.”](#during-the-democrat-convention-the-words-under-god-were-removed-from-the-pledge-of-allegiance-not-once-but-twice-we-will-never-d)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>The is misleading.</span>

The Democratic National Convention recited the Pledge of Allegiance on
all four nights including the words “under God.” So did most of its
caucuses, which took place before the prime-time programming. Several
smaller meetings — two meetings of the L.G.B.T.Q. Caucus and one
gathering of the Muslim Assembly — recited the Pledge of Allegiance
omitting the words “under God.”

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

Earl D. Fowlkes Jr., chairman of the L.G.B.T.Q. Caucus, said the
decision to omit the words was made by two separate individuals who were
asked to lead the pledge and was not a policy decision. “It was a
personal preference,” Mr. Fowlkes said. “I was just as surprised as
everyone else.”

But the central programming of the convention featured the entire
pledge, complete with “under God,” on each of its four nights. On the
first night, Mr. Biden’s grandchildren said the pledge, followed by the
convention’s chorus of “The Star-Spangled Banner.” On the second night,
a pledge was recited by a diverse group of Americans, as it was again on
the third night. On the fourth night, Cedric Richmond Jr., the son of
Representative Cedric Richmond, Democrat of Louisiana, said the pledge.
Each night, the pledge included the words “under God.”

</div>

<div id="instead-of-following-the-science-joe-biden-wants-to-inflict-a-painful-shutdown-on-the-entire-country" class="css-608m5d">

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2019/08/28/reader-center/author-thomas-kaplan/author-thomas-kaplan-thumbLarge-v2.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/thomas-kaplan)

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Instead of following the science, Joe Biden wants to inflict a painful shutdown on the entire country.”](#instead-of-following-the-science-joe-biden-wants-to-inflict-a-painful-shutdown-on-the-entire-country)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is exaggerated.</span>

Mr. Biden has emphasized the importance of deferring to science when it
comes to responding to the coronavirus. In an interview last week, he
expressed a willingness to shut down the country if recommended by
scientists, but he is not promising a shutdown no matter what.

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

In the interview, ABC’s David Muir asked Mr. Biden, “If you’re sworn in
come January and we have coronavirus and the flu combining, which many
scientists have said is a real possibility, would you be prepared to
shut this country down again?”

Mr. Biden responded: “I will be prepared to do whatever it takes to save
lives, because we cannot get the country moving until we control the
virus. That is the fundamental flaw of this administration’s thinking to
begin with. In order to keep the country running and moving and the
economy growing and people employed, you have to fix the virus. You have
to deal with the virus.”

Pressed on what he would do “if the scientists say shut it down,” as Mr.
Muir put it, Mr. Biden responded: “I would shut it down. I would listen
to the scientists.”

</div>

Read
more

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312579">

<div id="biden-voted-for-the-nafta-disaster-the-single-worst-trade-deal-ever-enacted-he-supported-chinas-entry-into-the-world-trade-organ" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/12/10/multimedia/author-ana-swanson/author-ana-swanson-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/ana-swanson)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:25 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:25
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Ana
Swanson</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/ana-swanson)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Biden voted for the NAFTA disaster, the single worst trade deal ever enacted. He supported China’s entry into the World Trade Organization, one of the greatest economic disasters of all time. After those Biden calamities, the United States lost 1 in 4 manufacturing jobs.”](#biden-voted-for-the-nafta-disaster-the-single-worst-trade-deal-ever-enacted-he-supported-chinas-entry-into-the-world-trade-organ)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is mostly true.</span>

Mr. Biden did vote to approve the North American Free Trade Agreement in
1993 and supported China’s entry into the World Trade Organization,
which occurred in December 2001. Since then, the number of American
workers employed in manufacturing [shrank from 15.7 million to 12.1
million](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bls.gov%2Fiag%2Ftgs%2Fiag31-33.htm),
a loss of a little less than 1 in 4 jobs.

Many economists believe that the entry of such a massive country as
China into the global marketplace created [a shock that was
responsible](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchinashock.info%2Fpapers%2F)
for some of this job loss, though many economic studies have found that
NAFTA had [little to no effect on net American
employment](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffas.org%2Fsgp%2Fcrs%2Frow%2FR42965.pdf).
But other major economic trends have also contributed to the shedding of
American manufacturing jobs, including increasing automation,
globalization and the rise of international supply chains, and the
information technology revolution, which allowed companies to separate
their operations for designing and manufacturing
goods.

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312576">

<div id="joe-biden-claims-he-has-empathy-for-the-vulnerable-yet-the-party-he-leads-supports-the-extreme-late-term-abortion-of-defenseless" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/11/26/multimedia/author-sheryl-gay-stolberg/author-sheryl-gay-stolberg-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/sheryl-gay-stolberg)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:21 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:21
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Sheryl Gay
Stolberg</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/sheryl-gay-stolberg)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Joe Biden claims he has empathy for the vulnerable, yet the party he leads supports the extreme late-term abortion of defenseless babies, right up until the moment of birth.”](#joe-biden-claims-he-has-empathy-for-the-vulnerable-yet-the-party-he-leads-supports-the-extreme-late-term-abortion-of-defenseless)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is exaggerated.** </span>

Democrats support abortion rights, but that does not mean they call for
women to have an unfettered right to terminate pregnancies up until the
point of birth. Mr. Trump may have been referring to a debate over a
bill proposed last year by Democrats in the Virginia legislature that
would have made it easier for women to obtain abortions late in
pregnancy if the mother’s physical health or safety were at risk.

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

The proposed legislation prompted Senator Ted Cruz, Republican of Texas,
to falsely claim that Democrats support “abortion up until the moment of
birth and even, horrifically, after that.” Other Republicans have echoed
the claim.

Democrats support codifying Roe v. Wade, the landmark 1973 decision that
held states could prohibit abortion after fetal viability — the point at
which fetuses can sustain life outside the womb. The current Supreme
Court standard holds that states may prohibit abortion after fetal
viability so long as there are exceptions for the life and health of the
mother.

“Like the majority of Americans, Democrats believe that every woman
should be able to access high-quality reproductive health care services,
including safe and legal abortion,” [the party’s draft 2020
platform](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.demconvention.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2020%2F07%2F2020-07-21-DRAFT-Democratic-Party-Platform.pdf)
states, adding, “Democrats oppose and will fight to overturn federal and
state laws that create barriers to women’s reproductive health and
rights.”

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“When I took bold action to issue a travel ban on China, very early indeed, Joe Biden called it hysterical and xenophobic.”](#when-i-took-bold-action-to-issue-a-travel-ban-on-china-very-early-indeed-joe-biden-called-it-hysterical-and-xenophobic)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is false.**</span>

Mr. Biden did not say those words about Mr. Trump’s partial travel ban
on China, which was aimed at limiting the spread of the coronavirus in
the United States. Mr. Trump announced the ban on Jan. 31. Mr. Biden
[wrote](https://twitter.com/JoeBiden/status/1223727977361338370?s=20)
the next day on Twitter that Mr. Trump has a “record of hysteria,
xenophobia, and fear-mongering.” But he did not say that specifically
about the travel ban. Mr. Biden’s aides later said he supported travel
bans based on science. Mr. Trump did not announce the partial ban “very
early” relative to other nations. The United States was in the [third
wave of
nations](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/04/07/trumps-claim-that-he-imposed-first-china-ban/)
that enacted some form of travel ban on China in
January.

## [“Biden has promised to abolish the production of American oil, coal, shale and natural gas.”](#biden-has-promised-to-abolish-the-production-of-american-oil-coal-shale-and-natural-gas)

</div>

Mr. Biden has made no such promise, nor do his policy proposals ban
production of those energy sources. Mr. Biden’s climate change plan

land.

<div id="we-have-already-built-300-miles-of-border-wall-and-we-are-adding-10-new-miles-every-single-week-the-wall-will-soon-be-complete-a" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2019/12/13/reader-center/author-zolan-kanno-youngs/author-zolan-kanno-youngs-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/zolan-kanno-youngs)

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:16
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Zolan
Kanno-Youngs</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/zolan-kanno-youngs)

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“We have already built 300 miles of border wall, and we are adding 10 new miles every single week. The wall will soon be complete, and it is working beyond our wildest expectations.”](#we-have-already-built-300-miles-of-border-wall-and-we-are-adding-10-new-miles-every-single-week-the-wall-will-soon-be-complete-a)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is exaggerated. </span>

The Trump administration has built roughly 300 miles of new border wall,
although nearly all of it is in areas where dilapidated barriers existed
or vehicle barriers once stood. The administration is on track to just
barely meet Mr. Trump’s mandate of constructing 450 miles of border wall
by the end of the year. But much of it will not be in the Rio Grande
Valley, an area historically prone to illegal crossings where private
[landowners](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/05/29/us/politics/border-wall-coronavirus.html)
have fought in court against the construction project. The border wall
is also not working as Mr. Trump promised. Migrants have used power
tools to cut through it and
[ladders](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2019/12/26/us/politics/trump-border-wall.html)
to climb over it.

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312563">

<div id="over-the-past-three-months-we-have-gained-over-9-million-jobs-and-thats-a-record-in-the-history-of-our-country" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2020/07/03/reader-center/author-jeanna-smialek/author-jeanna-smialek-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/jeanna-smialek)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:10 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:10
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Jeanna
Smialek</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/jeanna-smialek)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Over the past three months, we have gained over 9 million jobs, and that’s a record in the history of our country.”](#over-the-past-three-months-we-have-gained-over-9-million-jobs-and-thats-a-record-in-the-history-of-our-country)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is misleading.** </span>

It is true that the United States economy gained more than 9 million
jobs between April and June, but it had lost more than 20 million
between February and April. The bounce-back was rapid in part because
many people had been only temporarily laid off as states shut down to
control the spread of the coronavirus and were then quickly rehired.
It’s an open question how robustly the remaining lost jobs will come
back as the recovery
progresses.

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312556">

<div id="we-shipped-hundreds-of-millions-of-masks-gloves-and-gowns-to-our-front-line-health-care-workers" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/11/26/multimedia/author-sheryl-gay-stolberg/author-sheryl-gay-stolberg-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/sheryl-gay-stolberg)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:08 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:08
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Sheryl Gay
Stolberg</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/sheryl-gay-stolberg)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“We shipped hundreds of millions of masks, gloves and gowns to our front-line health care workers.”](#we-shipped-hundreds-of-millions-of-masks-gloves-and-gowns-to-our-front-line-health-care-workers)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is misleading**. </span>

A [report by the inspector
general](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Foig.hhs.gov%2Foei%2Freports%2Foei-06-20-00300.pdf)
of the Department of Health and Human Services in the early days of the
pandemic found serious problems with the supplies shipped from the
strategic national stockpile. **“**Some hospitals noted that at the time
of our interview they had not received supplies from the Strategic
National Stockpile, or that the supplies that they had received were not
sufficient in quantity or quality,” the inspector general wrote. One
administrator stated that getting supplies from the stockpile was a
major challenge, saying that the supplies the hospital received “won’t
even last a day. We need gloves, we need masks with fluid shields on —
N95 masks — and we need
gowns.”

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312554">

<div id="he-opposed-killing-suleimani" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2019/10/25/reader-center/author-michael-crowley/author-michael-crowley-thumbLarge-v2.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/michael-crowley)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:08 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:08
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Michael
Crowley</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/michael-crowley)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“He opposed killing Suleimani.”](#he-opposed-killing-suleimani)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is true.**</span>

Mr. Biden suggested that the senior Iranian commander, Maj. Gen. Qassim
Suleimani, deserved to be killed — but doubted the intelligence that Mr.
Trump used to justify the strike and warned that it could lead to
dangerous military escalation.

Hours after the Jan. 2 missile strike that killed Mr. Suleimani, Mr.
Biden issued [a
statement](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2FJoeBiden%2Fstatus%2F1212954848666234880%2Fphoto%2F1)
highly critical of the operation. Although he said that Mr. Suleimani
“deserved to be brought to justice for his crimes against American
troops and thousands of innocents throughout the region,” Mr. Biden
called the strike “a hugely escalatory move in an already dangerous
region.” In a Democratic debate the next month, Mr. Biden implied that
he might have supported the killing if he believed that Mr. Suleimani
was plotting an imminent attack on Americans in the Middle East as Mr.
Trump claimed. But, he said, “the reason I wouldn’t have ordered the
strike is there isn’t any evidence yet of an imminent strike that was
going to come from him.” Mr. Biden has also said that Mr. Trump
“[flat-out
lied](https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.desmoinesregister.com%2Fstory%2Fnews%2Felections%2Fpresidential%2Fcaucus%2F2020%2F01%2F14%2Fdemocratic-debate-transcript-what-the-candidates-said-quotes%2F4460789002%2F)”
about the underlying intelligence, which has never been made public and
which members of Congress who have seen it have also questioned. In his
initial statement, Mr. Biden warned that “we could be on the brink of a
major conflict across the Middle East,” but that has not materialized.

</div>

<div id="ad-5" class="css-4dvyd6">

<div class="css-142l3g4">

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312550">

<div id="earlier-this-year-i-ended-the-nafta-nightmare-and-signed-the-brand-new-us-mexico-canada-agreement-into-law-as-vice-president-bid" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/12/10/multimedia/author-ana-swanson/author-ana-swanson-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/ana-swanson)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:07 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:07
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Ana
Swanson</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/ana-swanson)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Earlier this year, I ended the NAFTA nightmare and signed the brand-new U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement into law. … As vice president, \[Biden\] supported the Trans-Pacific Partnership, which would have been a death sentence for the U.S. auto industry. He backed the horrendous South Korea trade deal, which took many jobs from our country.”](#earlier-this-year-i-ended-the-nafta-nightmare-and-signed-the-brand-new-us-mexico-canada-agreement-into-law-as-vice-president-bid)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>This is exaggerated. </span>

President Trump has consistently tried to distance the trade deals he
has updated or revised from their earlier iterations that were written
by other administrations. But the revised trade deal with South Korea
that Mr. Trump signed in 2018 is a minor update to what he refers to as
“the horrendous South Korea trade deal.”

<div class="css-1dv1kvn">

That pact included steps to open up the Korean market to increased
American exports, most notably for automobiles, but there were [few
other fundamental
changes](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2018/09/24/us/politics/south-korea-trump-trade-deal.html)
to the existing agreement.

The United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement was a more significant
transformation of its predecessor, the 26-year-old North American Free
Trade Agreement. But while the 2,082-page pact includes [some important
changes](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/01/29/business/economy/usmca-deal.html)
in key areas, like incentives to make cars in North America and reforms
to Mexican labor rules, it’s also fair to describe it as an update of
the original NAFTA pact.

Much of the new agreement simply updates the pre-existing deal with new
laws on the internet, intellectual property protection, state-owned
enterprises and currency. And much of that updated language was itself
taken from the negotiated text of the Trans-Pacific Partnership, which
Mr. Trump derides.

</div>

Read
more

</div>

<div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312544">

<div id="we-also-passed-va-accountability-and-va-choice-our-great-veterans-we-are-taking-care-of-our-veterans-ninety-one-percent-approval" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/06/12/multimedia/author-linda-qiu/author-linda-qiu-thumbLarge.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/linda-qiu)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:02 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:02
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Linda
Qiu</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/linda-qiu)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“We also passed V.A. Accountability and V.A. Choice, our great veterans. We are taking care of our veterans. Ninety-one percent approval rating this month, the V.A. Given by our veterans. First time anything like that has happened.”](#we-also-passed-va-accountability-and-va-choice-our-great-veterans-we-are-taking-care-of-our-veterans-ninety-one-percent-approval)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>**This is misleading.** </span>

The Veterans Choice Program was [created
in 2014](https://www.congress.gov/bill/113th-congress/house-bill/3230)
after the [scandal of hidden waiting
lists](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2014/05/29/us/va-report-confirms-improper-waiting-lists-at-phoenix-center.html?module=inline)
at Department of Veterans Affairs hospitals. In 2018, Mr. Trump signed
[a
law](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2018/05/23/us/politics/veterans-health-care.html?module=inline)
that overhauled and consolidated Veterans Choice and other existing
programs into a single Veterans Community Care Program. It is unclear
what poll Mr. Trump is referring to, but 57 percent of veterans approved
of Mr. Trump’s handling of his duties as commander-in-chief and 92
percent of Republican veterans approved, according a 2019 poll from the
Pew Research
Center.

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post css-1kiesrm" data-test-id="live-blog-post" data-source-id="100000007312543">

<div id="days-after-taking-office-we-ended-the-unfair-and-very-costly-paris-climate-accord-and-secured-for-the-first-time-american-energy" class="css-608m5d">

</div>

<div class="css-pscyww">

[![](https://static01.graylady3jvrrxbe.onion/images/2018/10/03/multimedia/author-coral-davenport/author-coral-davenport-thumbLarge-v2.png)](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/coral-davenport)

<div class="css-10cqhhq">

<span class="css-xtl8uk"></span>

<div class="css-ki347z">

<span class="css-1656jku">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:00 p.m.
ET</span><span class="css-xwx5dt"></span>

</div>

<span class="css-1dv1kvn" data-aria-live="polite">Aug. 27, 2020, 11:00
p.m. ET</span>

By [<span class="css-1baulvz last-byline" itemprop="name">Coral
Davenport</span>](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/by/coral-davenport)

</div>

</div>

<div class="live-blog-post-headline css-j3uhc5">

## [“Days after taking office, we … ended the unfair and very costly Paris climate accord and secured for the first time American energy independence.”](#days-after-taking-office-we-ended-the-unfair-and-very-costly-paris-climate-accord-and-secured-for-the-first-time-american-energy)

</div>

— President Trump

### <span>False.</span>

While President Trump did withdraw the United States from the Paris
climate change agreement — [a move that was not legally initiated
until 2019](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2019/10/23/climate/trump-paris-climate-accord.html)
— the pact, which includes nearly every other nation on earth, remains
intact without the participation of the United States.

It is not accurate to say that the United States is “energy
independent,” a phrase that suggests that the United States is
independent of reliance on imported energy sources. In 2019, nearly half
the oil consumed by the United States was imported — [about 9 million
barrels per
day](https://www.eia.gov/tools/faqs/faq.php?id=727&t=6#:~:text=In%202019%2C%20the%20United%20States,\(including%20ethanol%20and%20biodiesel\).)
were imported of the roughly 20 million barrels per day that were
consumed, according to the Energy Information Administration, the
statistical arm of the Energy
Department.

</div>

# Our 2020 Election Guide

<div class="css-zkk2wn">

Updated  Sept. 8, 2020

</div>

-----

<div class="css-1yyoic1">

</div>

  - ## The Latest
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        President Trump and his party are using a playbook that aims to
        alarm people about crime in their backyards. It didn’t work in
        2018, but [both parties think it could resonate more this
        year](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/2020/09/08/us/politics/trump-republicans-fear-strategy.html?action=click&pgtype=Article&state=default&region=BELOW_MAIN_CONTENT&context=storylines_guide).

  - ## How to Win 270
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        Joe Biden and Donald Trump need 270 electoral votes to reach the
        White House. Try building [your own coalition of battleground
        states](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/us/elections/election-states-biden-trump.html?action=click&pgtype=Article&state=default&region=BELOW_MAIN_CONTENT&context=storylines_guide) to
        see potential outcomes.

  - ## Voting by Mail
    
      - 
        
        <div class="css-ods21c">
        
        </div>
        
        Will you have enough time to vote by mail in your state? Yes,
        but it’s risky to procrastinate. [Check your state’s
        deadline.](https://www.nytimes3xbfgragh.onion/interactive/2020/08/31/us/politics/vote-by-mail-deadlines.html?action=click&pgtype=Article&state=default&region=BELOW_MAIN_CONTENT&context=storylines_guide)
    
      -
